page.title: 04HOUSING IN LINTON
page.content: In{Linton}there are a lot of old houses ,dating back to the{17th {Century.}Any new development is mainly confined to converting existing old property.The{Post Office}is dated back to{1679.}The finest looking house in {Linton}is the{Old Hall}on the{Skipton road side,mainly{17th Century. On the North side of the main road, {Linton House}stands well back among the trees and is famous for its lovely show of Snowdrops in the Spring. Most of the old houses in{Linton}are made from{limestone,}this being the local natural stone. The{Alms Houses}used to be{Fountain {Hospital}but now they are used to house people who have fallen on hard times through illness or age.
